Comments_List: Prof. Wexler pushes students to examine a problem from all possible angles with empathy and compassion. Its a valuable skill set to have when working on issues of public space and interaction. I gained a level of nuance for the effects of modifying public sculpture on the public body that I did not have before.
I learned so much about Yale, cultural memory, American history and culture, and the sociopolitics of sculptures.
This course was excellent. I have no recommendations for improvement. It was exactly the content and problem solving that I hoped it would be.
The readings were not very evenly spaced--there were a ton at the beginning of the semester, and then none at the end. Ideally these would've been spread out more evenly.
Absolutely, this is the best course I have taken a Yale University thus far.
Highly! It's a really small seminar with an incredible teacher, and not a lot of work. Not to mention, you talk about really fascinating concepts--I definitely recommend!
